item.title: Theory: Evolutionary stable strategies
item.description: As we saw earlier, one of the interpretations of mixed strategy Nash equlibrium it determines the fraction of population playing a certain pure action. Maynard Smith and Price (1973) used this interpretation to propose an evolutionary mechanism via which agents can change their behavior across generations. For a facinating (non-technical) introduction to this area, see Maynard Smith (1982) and Dawkins (1976). The key idea in what is now called Evolutionary Game theory is that of evolutionary stable strategies, which we discuss here.
